intro: Arnebia waziristanica, commonly known as the Waziristan poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Pakistan. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange petals and capsule-like seed pods. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has small, alternate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
